title: Open Hours at the Environmental Education Center
description:
Date: December 21, 2021

Explore Brooklyn Bridge Park like never before during open hours at the Environmental Education Center!

The Environmental Education Center is now open for free, drop-in hours three afternoons a week at 99 Plymouth Street in Dumbo, Brooklyn! Get to know Brooklyn Bridge Park with monthly educational themes, a 250-gallon aquarium filled with critters from the East River, a 10’ scale model of Brooklyn Bridge Park, crafts, a reading corner, and much more.

Open Hours offer the opportunity for self-led investigation with guidance by expert educators to reveal the hidden stories found within and around Brooklyn Bridge Park.

*This event is subject to changes and cancellations. Please make sure you check the Brooklyn Bridge Park website before visiting.

2021 SCHEDULE

  • TUESDAYS - 3:00 p.m. - 5:00 p.m.
  • THURSDAYS - 3:00 p.m. - 5:00 p.m.
  • SATURDAYS - 1:00 p.m. - 5:00 p.m.

*The Education Center will be closed on the following upcoming dates:

  • Saturday, October 23
  • Thursday, November 25 and Saturday, November 27 (Thanksgiving)
  • December 23-January 1

Start time: 3:00 pm

End time: 5:00 pm

Contact phone: (718) 802-0603

Location: Environmental Education Center (in Brooklyn Bridge Park)

title: Art Exhibition: Wreath Interpretations
description:
Date: December 21, 2021

Celebrate the holiday season with this quirky and one-of-a-kind exhibition! NYC Parks’ annual Wreath Interpretations exhibition is back in person at the Arsenal Gallery after going virtual last year. Welcoming the holiday season with a variety of inventive and surprising wreaths, this year’s exhibition includes wreaths by nearly 40 artists, designers, and creative individuals of all ages who have used unexpected materials to reinvent the traditional holiday symbol.

Drawing on timely themes including the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic and climate change, to more personal subject matter, artists this year have created their wreaths using yo-yos, reused sardine cans, bicycle tubes, vintage maps, natural materials, and more.

This event is FREE and open to the public.

Know Before You Go

As a precaution due to COVID-19, several new policies are being implemented to keep visitors safe. To enter the gallery, COVID-19 vaccinations are required for those who are eligible, and mask-wearing is required for all. Guests will be required to sign in, and groups of five or more people can call (212) 360-8114 or email artandantiquities@parks.nyc.gov to pre-register.

Please note: The Arsenal Gallery will be closed on Friday, December 24, 2021 and Friday, December 31, 2021.

Image: Tom Fitzgibbon, Roundabout, 2021, Wood, steel, wire, LEDs, CPU, acrylic, clothespins

Start time: 9:00 am

End time: 5:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 360-8114

Location: Arsenal (in Central Park)

title: Art Exhibition: Wreath Interpretations
description:
Date: December 22, 2021

Celebrate the holiday season with this quirky and one-of-a-kind exhibition! NYC Parks’ annual Wreath Interpretations exhibition is back in person at the Arsenal Gallery after going virtual last year. Welcoming the holiday season with a variety of inventive and surprising wreaths, this year’s exhibition includes wreaths by nearly 40 artists, designers, and creative individuals of all ages who have used unexpected materials to reinvent the traditional holiday symbol.

Drawing on timely themes including the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic and climate change, to more personal subject matter, artists this year have created their wreaths using yo-yos, reused sardine cans, bicycle tubes, vintage maps, natural materials, and more.

This event is FREE and open to the public.

Know Before You Go

As a precaution due to COVID-19, several new policies are being implemented to keep visitors safe. To enter the gallery, COVID-19 vaccinations are required for those who are eligible, and mask-wearing is required for all. Guests will be required to sign in, and groups of five or more people can call (212) 360-8114 or email artandantiquities@parks.nyc.gov to pre-register.

Please note: The Arsenal Gallery will be closed on Friday, December 24, 2021 and Friday, December 31, 2021.

Image: Tom Fitzgibbon, Roundabout, 2021, Wood, steel, wire, LEDs, CPU, acrylic, clothespins

Start time: 9:00 am

End time: 5:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 360-8114

Location: Arsenal (in Central Park)

title: Forest Fitness
description:
Date: December 22, 2021

Join us for Fitness at the Fort!

Incorporating climbing multiple staircases, stretches and strengthening exercises, notable tree identification, and forest bathing.

Instructor: Nancy Bruning, BA, MPH, PAPHS

Start: October 18, 2022

End : January 14, 2022

Hiatus: November 8-19

Fall/Winter 2021-2022 Class Descriptions:

Mondays: Easy Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance. Walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing.

Walk south to Cabrini Woods for cardio steps and strengthening exercises and walk uphill to Billings Overlook for closing stretches.

Wednesdays: Moderate Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing.

Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises, and walk uphill past Gazebo/Dog Run to Café Lawn, end with stretches.

Fridays: Intense Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretch and cardio stair climbing.

Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises.

Walk uphill towards Gazebo/Dog Run, utilizing a cluster of steps west of Broadway Path.

Walk along the upper Alpine Garden path, to volleyball courts for stretches with final stair climbing to Margaret Corbin Circle.

Start time: 7:00 am

End time: 7:45 am

Contact phone: (212) 795-1388

title: Art Exhibition: Wreath Interpretations
description:
Date: December 23, 2021

Celebrate the holiday season with this quirky and one-of-a-kind exhibition! NYC Parks’ annual Wreath Interpretations exhibition is back in person at the Arsenal Gallery after going virtual last year. Welcoming the holiday season with a variety of inventive and surprising wreaths, this year’s exhibition includes wreaths by nearly 40 artists, designers, and creative individuals of all ages who have used unexpected materials to reinvent the traditional holiday symbol.

Drawing on timely themes including the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic and climate change, to more personal subject matter, artists this year have created their wreaths using yo-yos, reused sardine cans, bicycle tubes, vintage maps, natural materials, and more.

This event is FREE and open to the public.

Know Before You Go

As a precaution due to COVID-19, several new policies are being implemented to keep visitors safe. To enter the gallery, COVID-19 vaccinations are required for those who are eligible, and mask-wearing is required for all. Guests will be required to sign in, and groups of five or more people can call (212) 360-8114 or email artandantiquities@parks.nyc.gov to pre-register.

Please note: The Arsenal Gallery will be closed on Friday, December 24, 2021 and Friday, December 31, 2021.

Image: Tom Fitzgibbon, Roundabout, 2021, Wood, steel, wire, LEDs, CPU, acrylic, clothespins

Start time: 9:00 am

End time: 5:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 360-8114

Location: Arsenal (in Central Park)

title: Forest Fitness
description:
Date: December 24, 2021

Join us for Fitness at the Fort!

Incorporating climbing multiple staircases, stretches and strengthening exercises, notable tree identification, and forest bathing.

Instructor: Nancy Bruning, BA, MPH, PAPHS

Start: October 18, 2022

End : January 14, 2022

Hiatus: November 8-19

Fall/Winter 2021-2022 Class Descriptions:

Mondays: Easy Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance. Walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing.

Walk south to Cabrini Woods for cardio steps and strengthening exercises and walk uphill to Billings Overlook for closing stretches.

Wednesdays: Moderate Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing.

Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises, and walk uphill past Gazebo/Dog Run to Café Lawn, end with stretches.

Fridays: Intense Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretch and cardio stair climbing.

Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises.

Walk uphill towards Gazebo/Dog Run, utilizing a cluster of steps west of Broadway Path.

Walk along the upper Alpine Garden path, to volleyball courts for stretches with final stair climbing to Margaret Corbin Circle.

Start time: 7:00 am

End time: 7:45 am

Contact phone: (212) 795-1388

title: Forest Fitness
description:
Date: December 27, 2021

Join us for Fitness at the Fort!

Incorporating climbing multiple staircases, stretches and strengthening exercises, notable tree identification, and forest bathing.

Instructor: Nancy Bruning, BA, MPH, PAPHS

Start: October 18, 2022

End : January 14, 2022

Hiatus: November 8-19

Fall/Winter 2021-2022 Class Descriptions:

Mondays: Easy Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance. Walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing.

Walk south to Cabrini Woods for cardio steps and strengthening exercises and walk uphill to Billings Overlook for closing stretches.

Wednesdays: Moderate Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing.

Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises, and walk uphill past Gazebo/Dog Run to Café Lawn, end with stretches.

Fridays: Intense Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretch and cardio stair climbing.

Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises.

Walk uphill towards Gazebo/Dog Run, utilizing a cluster of steps west of Broadway Path.

Walk along the upper Alpine Garden path, to volleyball courts for stretches with final stair climbing to Margaret Corbin Circle.

Start time: 7:00 am

End time: 7:45 am

Contact phone: (212) 795-1388

Location: Margaret Corbin Circle (in Fort Tryon Park)

title: Art Exhibition: Wreath Interpretations
description:
Date: December 27, 2021

Celebrate the holiday season with this quirky and one-of-a-kind exhibition! NYC Parks’ annual Wreath Interpretations exhibition is back in person at the Arsenal Gallery after going virtual last year. Welcoming the holiday season with a variety of inventive and surprising wreaths, this year’s exhibition includes wreaths by nearly 40 artists, designers, and creative individuals of all ages who have used unexpected materials to reinvent the traditional holiday symbol.

Drawing on timely themes including the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic and climate change, to more personal subject matter, artists this year have created their wreaths using yo-yos, reused sardine cans, bicycle tubes, vintage maps, natural materials, and more.

This event is FREE and open to the public.

Know Before You Go

As a precaution due to COVID-19, several new policies are being implemented to keep visitors safe. To enter the gallery, COVID-19 vaccinations are required for those who are eligible, and mask-wearing is required for all. Guests will be required to sign in, and groups of five or more people can call (212) 360-8114 or email artandantiquities@parks.nyc.gov to pre-register.

Please note: The Arsenal Gallery will be closed on Friday, December 24, 2021 and Friday, December 31, 2021.

Image: Tom Fitzgibbon, Roundabout, 2021, Wood, steel, wire, LEDs, CPU, acrylic, clothespins

Start time: 9:00 am

End time: 5:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 360-8114

Location: Arsenal (in Central Park)

title: Make Your Own Winter Lantern at Snug Harbor
description:
Date: December 28, 2021

Build your own lantern in the style of the Lunar New Year! Learn why lanterns play such an important role in Chinese celebrations. Working with basic materials, families will build a lantern from scratch to light up the holiday.

The workshop lasts one hour. Participating families will receive one free ticket to the New York Winter Lantern Festival.

To attend this indoor event, Snug Harbor requires proof of vaccination along with a photo ID for all participants over 11 years of age. All participants must remain masked while indoors.

This program is made possible with funding provided by the New York City Council through the Cultural Immigrant Initiative, a program of the New York City Department of Cultural Affairs. Snug Harbor thanks Council Members Joseph Borelli, Steven Matteo, and Debi Rose for their generous allocations.

This event is also supported in part by the New York Winter Lantern Festival.

Start time: 3:00 pm

End time: 4:00 pm

Contact phone: (718) 425-3504

Location: Building P (in Snug Harbor Cultural Center)

title: Art Exhibition: Wreath Interpretations
description:
Date: December 28, 2021

Celebrate the holiday season with this quirky and one-of-a-kind exhibition! NYC Parks’ annual Wreath Interpretations exhibition is back in person at the Arsenal Gallery after going virtual last year. Welcoming the holiday season with a variety of inventive and surprising wreaths, this year’s exhibition includes wreaths by nearly 40 artists, designers, and creative individuals of all ages who have used unexpected materials to reinvent the traditional holiday symbol.

Drawing on timely themes including the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic and climate change, to more personal subject matter, artists this year have created their wreaths using yo-yos, reused sardine cans, bicycle tubes, vintage maps, natural materials, and more.

This event is FREE and open to the public.

Know Before You Go

As a precaution due to COVID-19, several new policies are being implemented to keep visitors safe. To enter the gallery, COVID-19 vaccinations are required for those who are eligible, and mask-wearing is required for all. Guests will be required to sign in, and groups of five or more people can call (212) 360-8114 or email artandantiquities@parks.nyc.gov to pre-register.

Please note: The Arsenal Gallery will be closed on Friday, December 24, 2021 and Friday, December 31, 2021.

Image: Tom Fitzgibbon, Roundabout, 2021, Wood, steel, wire, LEDs, CPU, acrylic, clothespins

Start time: 9:00 am

End time: 5:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 360-8114

Location: Arsenal (in Central Park)

title: Concert: Ray Martinez' Legacy
description:
Date: December 28, 2021

Join us for a concert featuring the great Ray Martinez’ Legacy. Born out of the multicultural dynamics of New York, Ray Martinez' Legacy connects musical concepts of Africa and the African Diaspora. The music fuses Afro-Jazz (Latin Jazz), the Blues, Funk and the folklore rhythms of the Caribbean to create a familiar yet new sound.

This project is supported, in part, by public funds from the New York City Department of Cultural Affairs in partnership with the City Council and the Bronx Council on the Arts.

Celebrate the holiday season with this quirky and one-of-a-kind exhibition! NYC Parks’ annual Wreath Interpretations exhibition is back in person at the Arsenal Gallery after going virtual last year. Welcoming the holiday season with a variety of inventive and surprising wreaths, this year’s exhibition includes wreaths by nearly 40 artists, designers, and creative individuals of all ages who have used unexpected materials to reinvent the traditional holiday symbol.

Drawing on timely themes including the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic and climate change, to more personal subject matter, artists this year have created their wreaths using yo-yos, reused sardine cans, bicycle tubes, vintage maps, natural materials, and more.

This event is FREE and open to the public.

Know Before You Go

As a precaution due to COVID-19, several new policies are being implemented to keep visitors safe. To enter the gallery, COVID-19 vaccinations are required for those who are eligible, and mask-wearing is required for all. Guests will be required to sign in, and groups of five or more people can call (212) 360-8114 or email artandantiquities@parks.nyc.gov to pre-register.

Please note: The Arsenal Gallery will be closed on Friday, December 24, 2021 and Friday, December 31, 2021.

Image: Tom Fitzgibbon, Roundabout, 2021, Wood, steel, wire, LEDs, CPU, acrylic, clothespins

Fall/Winter 2021-2022 Class Descriptions:

Mondays: Easy Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance. Walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing.

Walk south to Cabrini Woods for cardio steps and strengthening exercises and walk uphill to Billings Overlook for closing stretches.

Wednesdays: Moderate Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing.

Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises, and walk uphill past Gazebo/Dog Run to Café Lawn, end with stretches.

Fridays: Intense Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretch and cardio stair climbing.

Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises.

Walk uphill towards Gazebo/Dog Run, utilizing a cluster of steps west of Broadway Path.

Walk along the upper Alpine Garden path, to volleyball courts for stretches with final stair climbing to Margaret Corbin Circle.

title: Art Exhibition: Wreath Interpretations
description:
Date: December 30, 2021

Celebrate the holiday season with this quirky and one-of-a-kind exhibition! NYC Parks’ annual Wreath Interpretations exhibition is back in person at the Arsenal Gallery after going virtual last year. Welcoming the holiday season with a variety of inventive and surprising wreaths, this year’s exhibition includes wreaths by nearly 40 artists, designers, and creative individuals of all ages who have used unexpected materials to reinvent the traditional holiday symbol.

Drawing on timely themes including the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic and climate change, to more personal subject matter, artists this year have created their wreaths using yo-yos, reused sardine cans, bicycle tubes, vintage maps, natural materials, and more.

This event is FREE and open to the public.

Know Before You Go

As a precaution due to COVID-19, several new policies are being implemented to keep visitors safe. To enter the gallery, COVID-19 vaccinations are required for those who are eligible, and mask-wearing is required for all. Guests will be required to sign in, and groups of five or more people can call (212) 360-8114 or email artandantiquities@parks.nyc.gov to pre-register.

Please note: The Arsenal Gallery will be closed on Friday, December 24, 2021 and Friday, December 31, 2021.

Image: Tom Fitzgibbon, Roundabout, 2021, Wood, steel, wire, LEDs, CPU, acrylic, clothespins

Start time: 9:00 am

End time: 5:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 360-8114

Location: Arsenal (in Central Park)

title: Forest Fitness
description:
Date: December 31, 2021

Join us for Fitness at the Fort!

Incorporating climbing multiple staircases, stretches and strengthening exercises, notable tree identification, and forest bathing.

Instructor: Nancy Bruning, BA, MPH, PAPHS

Start: October 18, 2022

End : January 14, 2022

Hiatus: November 8-19

Fall/Winter 2021-2022 Class Descriptions:

Mondays: Easy Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance. Walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing.

Walk south to Cabrini Woods for cardio steps and strengthening exercises and walk uphill to Billings Overlook for closing stretches.

Wednesdays: Moderate Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretching and cardio stair climbing.

Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises, and walk uphill past Gazebo/Dog Run to Café Lawn, end with stretches.

Fridays: Intense Pace

Meet at the Heather Garden entrance and walk along Stan Michels Promenade to Linden Terrace for dynamic warm-up stretch and cardio stair climbing.

Walk along the western path to Broadway, incorporating strengthening exercises.

Walk uphill towards Gazebo/Dog Run, utilizing a cluster of steps west of Broadway Path.

Walk along the upper Alpine Garden path, to volleyball courts for stretches with final stair climbing to Margaret Corbin Circle.

Start time: 7:00 am

End time: 7:45 am

Contact phone: (212) 795-1388

Location: Margaret Corbin Circle (in Fort Tryon Park)

The group will not meet during inclement weather or when temperatures fall below 40 degrees; please dress for the weather. For everyone’s safety we’re asking participants and instructors to wear a face covering and maintain social distancing of 10 feet during class. title: Art Exhibition: Wreath Interpretations
description:
Date: January 3, 2022

Celebrate the holiday season with this quirky and one-of-a-kind exhibition! NYC Parks’ annual Wreath Interpretations exhibition is back in person at the Arsenal Gallery after going virtual last year. Welcoming the holiday season with a variety of inventive and surprising wreaths, this year’s exhibition includes wreaths by nearly 40 artists, designers, and creative individuals of all ages who have used unexpected materials to reinvent the traditional holiday symbol.

Drawing on timely themes including the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic and climate change, to more personal subject matter, artists this year have created their wreaths using yo-yos, reused sardine cans, bicycle tubes, vintage maps, natural materials, and more.

This event is FREE and open to the public.

Know Before You Go

As a precaution due to COVID-19, several new policies are being implemented to keep visitors safe. To enter the gallery, COVID-19 vaccinations are required for those who are eligible, and mask-wearing is required for all. Guests will be required to sign in, and groups of five or more people can call (212) 360-8114 or email artandantiquities@parks.nyc.gov to pre-register.

Please note: The Arsenal Gallery will be closed on Friday, December 24, 2021 and Friday, December 31, 2021.

Image: Tom Fitzgibbon, Roundabout, 2021, Wood, steel, wire, LEDs, CPU, acrylic, clothespins

Location: Arsenal (in Central Park)

title: Art Exhibition: Wreath Interpretations
description:
Date: January 4, 2022

Celebrate the holiday season with this quirky and one-of-a-kind exhibition! NYC Parks’ annual Wreath Interpretations exhibition is back in person at the Arsenal Gallery after going virtual last year. Welcoming the holiday season with a variety of inventive and surprising wreaths, this year’s exhibition includes wreaths by nearly 40 artists, designers, and creative individuals of all ages who have used unexpected materials to reinvent the traditional holiday symbol.

Drawing on timely themes including the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic and climate change, to more personal subject matter, artists this year have created their wreaths using yo-yos, reused sardine cans, bicycle tubes, vintage maps, natural materials, and more.

This event is FREE and open to the public.

Know Before You Go

As a precaution due to COVID-19, several new policies are being implemented to keep visitors safe. To enter the gallery, COVID-19 vaccinations are required for those who are eligible, and mask-wearing is required for all. Guests will be required to sign in, and groups of five or more people can call (212) 360-8114 or email artandantiquities@parks.nyc.gov to pre-register.

Please note: The Arsenal Gallery will be closed on Friday, December 24, 2021 and Friday, December 31, 2021.

Image: Tom Fitzgibbon, Roundabout, 2021, Wood, steel, wire, LEDs, CPU, acrylic, clothespins

Start time: 9:00 am

End time: 5:00 pm

Contact phone: (212) 360-8114

Location: Arsenal (in Central Park)
